intro: Lasiacis liebmanniana, commonly known as the Liebmann's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Lasiacis liebmanniana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
